item.title: Outreachy
item.description: Last month I applied to Outreachy, a paid internship for non-students from underrepresented groups in technology. Instead of interviewing based on your resume, part of the application involves making a contribution to the open source project you're hoping to work for. Since the internship employers tend to be big names …
item.dc:creator: Christalee Bieber

item.title: syntax highlighting & feeds
item.description: I haven't written much about the process of putting this blog together because I want it to speak for itself, but I wanted to write a short note about two features I added today. One was syntax highlighting, using pygment's 'friendly' theme. (Thanks to this gallery for showing off the …

item.description: Over the past couple of weeks, I and some colleagues in the Mastering Large Datasets with Python group have been practicing our new ability to scrape and process large amount of data with Spark, by harvesting public messages from the RC Zulip and analyzing them. item.title: Puzzling Goings-On
item.description: Today, an RC colleague organized a group to tackle a git mystery, in which murder has been done and the clues are hidden in commit messages. My group did not solve the crime within the hour, nor did we limit ourselves to git commands. But we appreciated the spirit of …

item.title: Three Things Learned
item.description:
I haven't been keeping up with this blog, but I have been keeping busy. A few things I've learned recently:

  • Although JavaScript has a typeof command, it doesn't produce very useful output. In particular, it yields object no matter whether the structure in question is a Map, an Array, a …
item.dc:creator: Christalee Bieber

item.title: refactoring checklist; ML project ideas
item.description:
In a recent conversation I mentioned that when I meet a new Python feature, I add it to my refactoring checklist. Someone asked me to share that checklist, and here it is, slightly expanded:

  • write all comments/docstrings
  • resolve all TODOs
  • add types to all fn declarations and key local …

item.title: RC Week 1
item.description: My first week at the Recurse Center has been a bit of a firehose, mostly socially. item.title: Denim Duvet
item.description: Over the years, I've gone through a lot of jeans. Usually I retire them for excessive rips and holes, although my standards have risen steadily. item.title: Advent of Code 2020, in JavaScript
item.description:
I’m doing Advent of Code this year using JavaScript, with the goal of forcing myself to learn the ins and outs of the language. And boy, does it have a lot of those. Here are some reflections on traps and quirks I’ve discovered.

item.title: Embroidery
item.description:
As a child, I learned to cross-stitch. As an adult, I've returned to it as a relatively quiet, clean, soothing hobby I can pick up at idle moments that nevertheless produces something lasting and beautiful. Projects I've been working on include:

item.title: Family Cookbook
item.description: My extended family likes to cook, especially at the holidays, and frequently I hear, “What’s the recipe for X? Ask Y, they’ll know.” And then the recipe will be dredged up from memory, or a dusty cookbook, or someone’s text history, or photos of a dusty cookbook …

item.description: Anyone teaching computer-related topics in 2017 knows that: the range of skills, compensation levels, and working conditions in "tech" is huge and unpredictable; and, trying to future-proof your students is impossible.

item.description: You never forget your first, and for me, it's true for my first job: working with faculty to publish open educational content at MIT OpenCourseWare.
